title: Authors and Citation
text: Benedikt B. Claus. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Claus B (2023). benelib: Helper Functions R Workflow. R package version 1.1.1, https://benediktclaus.github.io/benelib.
code: @Manual{,   title = {benelib: Helper Functions for My R Workflow},   author = {Benedikt B. Claus},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.1.1},   url = {https://benediktclaus.github.io/benelib}, }

title: A personal R package to make life easier
text: goal benelib make life considerably easier. package includes various helper functions ggplot2 plots, RStudio projects R Markdown templates things .

title: A personal R package to make life easier
text: can install loaded released version benelib GitHub :

title: A personal R package to make life easier
text: One main reasons package exist abilty change ggplot2’s default color fill scales given corporate design.
code: library(ggplot2) use_personal_theme()  palmer_penguins %>%    ggplot(aes(bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, color = species)) +   geom_point() #> Warning in check_font_path(italic, "italic"): 'italic' should be a length-one #> vector, using the first element

title: A personal R package to make life easier
text: Another nice addition personal ggplot2 theme.
code: palmer_penguins %>%    ggplot(aes(bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, color = species)) +   geom_point() +   theme_bene() #> Warning in check_font_path(italic, "italic"): 'italic' should be a length-one #> vector, using the first element

what: Compute Mean and its Standard Deviation for ggplot2 — mean_sd
title: Compute Mean and its Standard Deviation for ggplot2 — mean_sd
text: Compute mean standard deviation given vector. Can used fun.data ggplot2's stat_summary. comes handy plotting means standard deviations arguments must submitted.

title: Compute Mean and its Standard Deviation for ggplot2 — mean_sd
Compute Mean and its Standard Deviation for ggplot2 — mean_sd
text: x numeric vector.

title: Compute Mean and its Standard Deviation for ggplot2 — mean_sd
text: tibble columns ymin, mean, ymax.

title: Compute Mean and its Standard Deviation for ggplot2 — mean_sd

title: Compute Median and its Standard Error for ggplot2 — median_se

Compute Median and its Standard Error for ggplot2 — median_se
text: x numeric vector.

title: Compute M-Estimator and its Standard Error for ggplot2 — mest_se

Compute M-Estimator and its Standard Error for ggplot2 — mest_se
text: x numeric vector.

title: Compute M-Estimator and its Standard Error for ggplot2 — mest_se
Open Current Working Directory — open_working_directory
text: Shortcut open current working directory R console. useful one uses file-launcher like one Microsoft PowerToys opens project file instead actual project folder.

title: Palmer Penguin Dataset — palmer_penguins
text: cleaned version Palmer Penguins dataset package palmerpenguins (.e. missing removed). serves primarily example dataset plotting examples.

title: Palmer Penguin Dataset — palmer_penguins
text: tibble 333 rows 8 columns species Penguin's species island Penguin's island bill_length_mm Bill length mm bill_depth_mm Bill depth mm flipper_length_mm Flipper length mm body_mass_g Weight g sex Sex year Year observation

title: Palmer Penguin Dataset — palmer_penguins
text: https://github.com/allisonhorst/palmerpenguins

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

what: Save plots for LaTeX reports in correct dimensions — report_save
title: Save plots for LaTeX reports in correct dimensions — report_save
text: function saves ggplot2 plot desired location correct dimensions LaTeX report. custom thematic theme used, works vector graphics (e.g., PDF).

title: Save plots for LaTeX reports in correct dimensions — report_save
code: report_save(   filename,   plot,   width = 11.75,   path = "04 Figures",   height = 9,   units = "cm" )

title: Save plots for LaTeX reports in correct dimensions — report_save
text: filename Desired filename plot Plot width Plot width, defaults 11.75 cm path Desired path saving height Plot height, defaults 9 cm units Unit, defaults "cm"

title: Save plots for LaTeX reports in correct dimensions — report_save
text: Nothing, used side-effects

what: Save A Plot With Custom Theming — save_custom_plot
title: Save A Plot With Custom Theming — save_custom_plot
text: various use_* functions benelib powered thematic package. powerful package makes possible use custom Google fonts without worrying plotting . However, comes small drawback saving plots. one uses ggplot2's ggsave function, text may rendered small raster images. thematic provides custom function, function simple wrapper.

title: Save A Plot With Custom Theming — save_custom_plot
code: save_custom_plot(   plot,   filename,   path,   width = 16,   height = 16,   units = "cm",   dpi = 320 )

title: Save A Plot With Custom Theming — save_custom_plot
text: plot ggplot2 plot. filename plot's desired file name. path desired path plot saved. width Plot width, defaults 16. height Plot height, defaults 16. units Plot dimension unit, defaults "cm". dpi Plot resolution, defaults 320.

title: Save A Plot With Custom Theming — save_custom_plot
text: Nothing, saves plot disk.

title: Save A Plot With Custom Theming — save_custom_plot
text: short: use plot theming function package want save raster image (JPG, PNG, etc.), use function save plot desired location.

title: Custom Theme for ggplot2 — theme_bene
text: Custom ggplot2 theme based theme_light().

title: Custom Theme for ggplot2 — theme_bene
text: base_size Integer, text base size

title: Custom Theme for ggplot2 — theme_bene
text: Theme ggplot2.

title: Custom Theme for ggplot2 — theme_bene
code: library(ggplot2)  if (FALSE) { palmer_penguins %>% ggplot(aes(bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, color = species)) +   geom_point() +   theme_bene() }

title: APA-Like Table Style — theme_gt_apa
text: Style gt table minimally APA-like style.

title: APA-Like Table Style — theme_gt_apa
text: table gt table

title: APA-Like Table Style — theme_gt_apa
text: formatted gt table

title: APA-like gtsummary theme — theme_gtsummary_apa
text: Set APA-like theme gtsummary tables, .e. means standard deviations two decimals calculated continuous variables, Welch test (default t.test function R calculates Welch test) default statistical test two group comparison, method correcting p-values false discovery rate correction.

title: APA-like gtsummary theme — theme_gtsummary_apa
text: set_theme Logial, defaults TRUE. Indicates whether theme loaded.

title: APA-like gtsummary theme — theme_gtsummary_apa
text: APA-like gtsummary table

title: APA-like gtsummary theme — theme_gtsummary_apa
code:
library(gtsummary) theme_gtsummary_apa() #> Setting theme `APA` trial %>% select(trt, age, response, ttdeath) %>% tbl_summary(by = trt) %>% add_n() %>% add_p() %>% add_q(quiet = TRUE) #>
#> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>

title: Set a Custom ggplot2 Theme — use_custom_theme
code: use_custom_theme(   palette = "main",   theme = "personal",   accent_color,   font = "Roboto",   reverse = FALSE )  use_personal_theme(   palette = "main",   theme = "personal",   accent_color,   font = "Roboto",   reverse = FALSE )  use_pedscience_theme(   palette = "main",   theme = "pedscience",   accent_color,   font = "Roboto",   reverse = FALSE )  use_palli_theme(   palette = "main",   theme = "palli",   accent_color,   font = "Roboto",   reverse = FALSE )  use_dksz_theme(   palette = "main",   theme = "dksz",   accent_color,   font = "Roboto",   reverse = FALSE )

title: Set a Custom ggplot2 Theme — use_custom_theme
text: palette palette theming_palettes. Can one "main" "sequential" "lighter" "darker" "pastel" vector strings HEX codes theme theme pick palette . Can one "personal" "pedscience" "palli" "dksz" accent_color accent color. Can string HEX value. default palettes accent color theming_palettes font String, Google Font. Default "Roboto" reverse Logical. palette reversed?

title: Set a Custom ggplot2 Theme — use_custom_theme
text: Nothing, called side effects

title: Set a Custom ggplot2 Theme — use_custom_theme
code: library(ggplot2) use_custom_theme(palette = "full")  example_plot <- mpg %>%   ggplot(aes(displ, hwy, color = as.factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() example_plot   use_personal_theme() example_plot   use_pedscience_theme() example_plot   use_palli_theme() example_plot   use_dksz_theme() example_plot   # Reset the theme with use_base_theme() example_plot

benelib 1.1.1
text: Fix ggplot2 theme (remove black border around facet labels rotate y-axis text correctly)

title: benelib 1.1.0
text: Include option specify custom palette vector HEX codes Implement optimized color palettes Change argument order use_custom_folder() provide folder name directly Add potential custom theming ggplot2 facets, omits default grey backgrounds white font color

title: benelib 1.0.0
text: First stable release theming functions noe reliably rewritten

title: benelib 0.11.0
text: Add report_save() function

title: benelib 0.10.0
text: Add ggplot2 summary functions stat_summary() (e.g., mean_sd())

title: benelib 0.9.1
text: Add open_working_directory(), little helper open current working directory use_custom_folder() can now used without path. path = NA, folder created current working directory.

title: benelib 0.9.0
text: benelib now uses completely new personal project setup function, employing mainly new use_custom_folder() use_.*_template() functions. makes project function much easier maintain also gives end user flexibility projects already created. use_custom_folder() can used create custom folder current working directory. check chosen name already ()n use adds new folder next seriated number. use_analysis_template can used create skeleton potential analyses used packages setups. use_data_cleaning_template() can used include skeleton cleaning wrangling raw data files CSV, XLSX (Excel) SAV (SPSS) files use_latex_template() creates folder containing LaTeX document prepopulated preamble filler text get going fast.

title: benelib 0.8.1
text: Eradicated graphics device error custom corporate plot theme used first plot produced (originated showtext package)

title: benelib 0.8.0
text: corporate theming functions now use usethis-style prefix use_* instead set_*. Now, plots custom corporate theming can saved save_custom_plot(), renders fonts (.e., font size) correctly.

title: benelib 0.7.1
text: Patch include analysis paragraph analysis document template.

title: benelib 0.7.0
text: Included correct font specification themes.

title: benelib 0.6.0
text: ggplot2 themes rewritten sratch employing thematic package consistent stable.

title: benelib 0.5.0
text: Added separate cleaning scripts CS, SPSS, Excel files

title: benelib 0.4.0
text: Added functionality RStudio template. Now, one can choose certain directories prepopulated files included project Fixed minor issues package website

title: benelib 0.3.0
text: Added new README

title: benelib 0.2.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Updated documentaton color fill scales custom ggplot2 designs
